chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The eSciDoc Core Java Client Library (short: client-lib) shall smooth the way for Java programmer to implement application on top of the eSciDoc infrastructure.
Each version of the eSciDoc Infrastructure Java Client Library supports a specific version of the eSciDoc infrastructure. The supported version of the infrastructure is shown within the package name.
This version of the client lib supports only eSciDoc infrastructures of the version 1.2 series. The compatibility with update versions of the 1.2 series should be given.
This client lib is not compatible with eSciDoc infrastructure version 1.0 or 1.1.

The infrastructure delivers XML representation to support programming language independent client applications. Programming with Java means usually to work with classes. This lib could hide all required steps to map between XML representation and class mapping. But if one does not need mapping he can still work in XML and snippets of XML and is still supported with method stubs to send requests to the infrastructure.

The client lib contains only little logic and does therefore give only little support to compile required values. Parameter and data structure checking is done by the infrastructure to avoid a duplication of logic. Nevertheless, makes it a pojo easy to explore settable values.
